meanings.definition: The action of loading or being loaded onto something.
meanings.sent1: The onload of the cargo onto the ship was completed smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The onload of groceries into the car was quick and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The onload of the clown into the tiny car was a hilarious sight.
meanings.sent4: The onload of responsibilities onto his shoulders felt overwhelming.
meanings.sent5: The onload of books onto the shelf created a neat and organized display.

meanings.definition: The event that occurs when a webpage is fully loaded and displayed in a browser.
meanings.sent1: The onload of the webpage showed all the content clearly.
meanings.sent2: The onload of the website took longer than expected due to heavy traffic.
meanings.sent3: The onload of the cat video made everyone in the room smile.
meanings.sent4: The onload of information onto the screen was like a digital magic trick.
meanings.sent5: The onload of images onto the webpage made it visually appealing.
